channel.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
channel.description:
Google has proved useless for me in this scenario.
So last night I was playing Plants Vs Zombies and the power went out. It wasn't storming or anything. The power just flickered, went out for about 10 seconds, and came back.
Well all my other PCs booted up fine. Except the one I was on. It said:
3rd Master Hard Disk Error Press F1 to resume.
After pressing F1, it brought me to a screen saying something about nothing to boot from, either change BIOS or insert boot media and press any key.
Same thing every time I restarted. I finally got into the BIOS, and it said I had two DVD drives (correct), a floppy (correct), and nothing else (not correct). My HD is plugged into the first SATA port. Boot order is floppy, CD, then nothing cause the HD wasn't there.
So it's not like the HD was empty or anything, it just wasn't recognizing it. So maybe it's the motherboard?
Booted up with Hiren bootcd, ran some tests. Motherboard tests all passed. Ran some HD tests. All the tests only had the option to test my two DVD drives, not the HD.
So I ran some different HD tests, partitioning and stuff. All of them said no HD to partition or test.
So I ran a miniature Windows 98 from the RAM. My Computer stated two DVD drives, the RAM drive, and no HD.
So I'm like fuck, it's not recognizing it. I plug the HD into the other three SATA ports and each time a different error.
4th Master Hard Disk Error. 3rd Slave Hard Disk Error. 4th Slave Hard Disk Error.
All the while nothing is recognizing the drive.
So I'm like shit time to buy a new HD. However I take out the bootcd and reboot again and what the fuck?
No I.D.E. Master HD (or something). Press F1 to resume.
So I notice in the list that there is a HD recognized at SATA4. I press F1 and WOW. It boots! Everything's normal.
Holy shit. It works. No need to buy another HD, it was just being stupid.
So all was fine, except I turned it off, put the cover back on, and booted again.
4th Slave Hard Disk Error.
Fuck not again. Well kinda, I rebooted 5 more times and on the 5th time I got
No I.D.E. Master HD
Again, and I pressed F1 and it booted fine.
So now if I ever have to reboot I probably have to do it a lot to get it to work.
Any idea what's going on?

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Corrupted what part of it?

Sounds like the boot sector. Have you tried it in another computer yet?

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Well the obvious things being written don’t seem to be affected, that’s why I was asking what part of it could be corrupted.

Have you plugged the HDD into another machine and attempted to mount/boot? If it works, you disk is fine.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Well the obvious things being written don’t seem to be affected, that’s why I was asking what part of it could be corrupted.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:8, topic:288384”]Corrupted what part of it? No data is missing, did a scan of the drive and nothing wrong, no bad anything.

I was playing Plants Vs Zombies, so maybe that was saving, but the game and save file work fine. I was downloading VMWare Workstation via bittorrent, but that checked out fine.

The only problem (that I can see, and so far) is that I have to boot multiple times to get it to work because it’s not recognizing a HD there.

Although, next time I get the time and can do without computers for a day, I’ll try putting it in another and testing it out.[/quote]
Most operating systems write to the disk no matter what the user is doing (even in idle).

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Corrupted what part of it? No data is missing, did a scan of the drive and nothing wrong, no bad anything.

I was playing Plants Vs Zombies, so maybe that was saving, but the game and save file work fine. I was downloading VMWare Workstation via bittorrent, but that checked out fine.

The only problem (that I can see, and so far) is that I have to boot multiple times to get it to work because it’s not recognizing a HD there.

Although, next time I get the time and can do without computers for a day, I’ll try putting it in another and testing it out.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:288384”]I usually leave this computer on 24/7 unless I do something like a huge update or install something. My other one I don’t.

I’d rather not turn this one off right now to try thing out if it’ll take me rebooting more and more to get it to work again. So for now I’ll leave this one on and working. But next time I have to turn it off I’ll try that.

Explain a surge protector. Like, the 6 outlet strip things with the on and reset button? Cause almost everything is on one of those.[/quote]
It should say something like surge/spike protector, cause some just have the reset for a different reason.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

My guess is something was being written to the HDD while the power killed and corrupted it.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Since it sounds like you have other computers, I would put the HD in another computer and reboot multiple times to see if it works. I would bet nothing is wrong except the hard drive was corrupted, so you would have to either try to repair it, or reformat and start over.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:288384”]I usually leave this computer on 24/7 unless I do something like a huge update or install something. My other one I don’t.

I’d rather not turn this one off right now to try thing out if it’ll take me rebooting more and more to get it to work again. So for now I’ll leave this one on and working. But next time I have to turn it off I’ll try that.

Explain a surge protector. Like, the 6 outlet strip things with the on and reset button? Cause almost everything is on one of those.[/quote]
Yeah, that’s most likely a surge protector.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I usually leave this computer on 24/7 unless I do something like a huge update or install something. My other one I don’t.

I’d rather not turn this one off right now to try thing out if it’ll take me rebooting more and more to get it to work again. So for now I’ll leave this one on and working. But next time I have to turn it off I’ll try that.

Explain a surge protector. Like, the 6 outlet strip things with the on and reset button? Cause almost everything is on one of those.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Sounds like your IDE/SATA controller(s) got zapped. Are all of your computers on an UPS/surge protector? To rule out HDD failure, plug the suspected HDD into a machine that is fine and ask is the HDD spinning? and is the HDD accessible.

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:1, topic:288384”]4th Master Hard Disk Error.
3rd Slave Hard Disk Error.
4th Slave Hard Disk Error.[/quote]
Sounds like the motherboard, though.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Master Hard Disk Error

item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

So last night I was playing Plants Vs Zombies and the power went out. It wasn’t storming or anything. The power just flickered, went out for about 10 seconds, and came back.

Well all my other PCs booted up fine. Except the one I was on. It said:
